doxygen about the class
+1, comments needed every where in this file.
Done
Please test poweron/off and oem-ibm disabled option.
@sagar - This still feels a lot more clumsy than how the code is already as of today. Need to refactor this a bit more.
Why do we need createOemFruHandler and createOemIbmFruHandler? We are inside OEM-IBM, can't we directly call createOemIbmFruHandler?
It is better to Create all the OEM handlers inside this class, to maintain uniformity.
doxygen about all the functions
Done
can you add doxygen about all variables?
Done

this can be changed to 
```
 std::tie(hostPDRHandler, oemPlatformHandler, fruHandler) =
        std::make_tuple(oemIBM->getHostPDRHandler(),
                        oemIBM->getOemPlatformHandler(), oemIBM->getFruHandler());
```
rather than passing empty pointers fir platformCOnfigHandler, hostPDRHandler ,  cant we send nullptr instead ?

I have now removed oemPlatformHandler from all base handlers and moved the creation of oemPlatformHandler inside the oem_ibm class. So that if OEM_IBM then the oemPlatformHandler will get assigned at a later point of time. I have adjusted the test cases as well accordingly.
this is present in line 258 as well, why do we need it twice ?

If OEM_IBM is enabled the flow will not reach line number 258, this needs to be done for "HostFirmware interface needs access to hostPDR to know if host is running". line number 258 is in the else part.

can any of these work ? if the hostEID is not present ? shouldn't this be under if(hostEID) section ?

if we move this logic inside hostEID,section ? then we already have hostPDRHandler there ? and also setHostPdrObj() does not have any special IBM code + since we get hostPDRhandler in the if(hostEID) section , we might be able to eleminate another dbusImplHost.setHostPdrObj().
can't these be set as part of the constructor itself. why do we need another public function to set the handlers.

oemPlatformHandler is used to pass as an argument for registering pldm base handler at line 287.
similarly, platformHandler and fruHandler are passed as arguments for registering and platform snd fro handlers. We need to pass the right handlers for registration.
is this a related change ?
will this be invoked if oem-ibm is enabled and we want the hostPDRHandler to be initialised too if hostEID is present? this portion is a else of ifdef OEM_IBM, right?

if OEM_IBM is enabled then we enter into oemIBM class where are doing this step also. please check oemIBM class constructor pldmd/oem_ibm.hpp. There again we are checking for hostEID and hostPDRHandler is populated.
const handler ?
cannot make the handler const as we will be calling non-const members of the oem_platform handler class which leads to "argument discards qualifiers"
ack
we can put this back in the same place & this needs a sane default, since its not been initialized as part of the constructor. This comment applies everywhere
Done
this could be inline function
+1 here and everywhere.
Done
new line ?
Done
wrapping
Done
why virtual destructor since it's not inherited from anywhere?

+1

Scott Meyers book actually says this as one of its item
```
The bottom line is that gratuitously declaring all destructors virtual is
just as wrong as never declaring them virtual. In fact, many people
summarize the situation this way: declare a virtual destructor in a
class if and only if that class contains at least one virtual function.
```
Done
since many unique pointer has cyclic dependency how would it be free the memory when PLDM goes down? even with current design also the same problem might be exist.
Can we avoid creating above pointers and use them as we receive them in constructor?
Can you elaborate what you mean ?

platformHandler, fruHandler and base handlers are created in pldmd.cpp at line 265, 255, and 271 and passed to the constructor of OemIBM class. We do not need to save those pointer inside OemHandler rather we can use them inside constructor.
In the current implementation we have two pointer created for each of the above, one in pldm.cpp one as member variable of OemIBM.
Done
why this change was added??
Done
